node.title: Oral Health and Overall Health
node.label: 19. May 2020
node.introduction: How much do you know? Maybe you haven't given it much thought, after all who thinks that joint pain, confusion or heart health is related to their mouth. Surprisingly it is!

node.title: Dogs and Gut Health
node.label: 15. May 2020
node.introduction: If you have a dog, ask yourself this question. Why did you make the decision to get him or her?

node.alt: Photo of a puppy.  We all love a puppy.

node.title: Coconut, Cacao Chia Pots
node.introduction: These creamy pots of yumminess are packed full of fibre and heart health omega 3 fats. They also happen to be vegan, gluten and dairy free! Enjoy at breakfast or anytime of the day!

node.title: Pecan Banana Bread
node.introduction: It's super filling and packed full of good fats which will keep you full and help stabilise blood sugar. Great for breakfast or as an afternoon snack.

node.text:
Today's lunch was delicious! Left over chilli piled on to roasted aubergine, topped with fresh coriander, cherry toms, jalapenos and a little coconut yogurt!  So good! What are your favourite ways to use up left over chilli?🍆😎🌶️
#leftoversforlunch #aubergineemoji #eatmorefibre #eatmoreplants #plantpower #feedthemicrobiome #healthyfood #energise #restore #nourish #rebalancingyou #roastedaubergine

Happy Monday everyone! Just having two of my favourite things!!! Sweet rhubarb tea thank you @taylors and pistachios! Pistachios are a good source of fibre, B vitamins and antioxidants. They can also help to balance blood sugar, boost immunity,  reduce inflammation and are great for skin health! Plus they come in cute little shells. Win win!! 😎
#gutfood #happyguthappyyou #fibre #eatmorefibre #eatmoreplants #plantpower #feedthemicrobiome #healthyfood #bloodsugarbalance #personalisednutrition  #energise #restore #nourish #rebalancingyou #pistachiosrule #skinhealth

Well it is the Queen's birthday! 👑

Gluten Free Almond Scones (Use normal SR flour if not gluten free) Makes 8-10 scones

215g gluten free raising flour
50g ground almonds
1 tea spoon baking powder
2 table spoons caster sugar
70g unsalted butter
1 egg 
85ml milk * Place the flour and ground almonds in a bowl mix well. Use your fingers to rub in the butter to form fine crumbs (or use a food processor, much easier!)
* Stir in the caster sugar, set aside. * Whisk the egg and milk together reserving 1 tablespoon.
* Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and add the egg and milk, use a fork to mix in. * Turn out onto a floured surface and knead briefly to form a soft smooth dough. * Pat out the mixture to a thickness of around 3cm and cut out rounds with a biscuit cutter. * Place on a lined baking sheet, brush with the reserved egg mixture.
* Bake at 220 C or Gas mark 7 for 8-10 minutes. 
Serve warm with clotted cream and raspberry jam. 
P.S. THE CREAM GOES ON FIRST!! #thecreamgoesfirst #creamtea #itstheweekendbaby #earlgrey
#rebalancingyou #glutenfreeeats #homemade 
#goodfood #goodforthesoul❤️

metadata.siteDescription: ENERGISE, RESTORE, NOURISH. I'm studying with the renowned Institute for Optimum Nutrition and will qualify next year. Until then, this is a place to inspire and share healthful information, tips, tricks and recipes. I hope to energise, restore and nourish your body mind and soul!
